Today's story is about a girl named Vanessa, who literally travels around the world through pet sitting.  What does this mean?  It means that she gets free accommodation and gets to bond with the cutest pets, while having the ability to discover new cities around the world.  She's already been to Japan, Singapore, South Korea, and next is Malaysia -- and because she works online, her office can be from anywhere! Sounds like a dream life, right?  

I got connected with Vanessa last week after she contacted me on TrustedHousesitters before Deanna and I went to Myanmar for Valentine's Day.  We needed someone to watch our baby pug, Dudoy, and she was the very first person to reach out.  

We are just blown away by how incredible the experiences has been, as well as how amazing Vanessa's life is!   We felt very comfortable knowing that she was in our apartment and caring for our baby pug.  It was a win-win for everyone involved, with no money exchange. title: HOW I FIND PEACE ‚õ≥
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM for more! https://www.instagram.com/drewbinsky/

When I am traveling the world, which I have been doing nonstop since August 2012, I am constantly stressed... The long layovers, unexpected delays, dangerous situations, difficulties of getting visas and daunting immigration checks ALL WHILE creating videos every day has led me to have severe anxiety.

But there is one way that I temporarily cure my anxiety, and that is by playing the sport of golf. I've played rounds in 42 countries -- from Vanuatu to Burundi to Guyana -- and it's the only time to relax my mind.

I realize that golf is likely a boring subject for you if you do not play, and that's why I hardly ever speak about it. I never want to bore you! But the truth is that this sport has played a huge part of my life since I was 12 and
I always wanted to be a professional golfer. In today's video, I want to open up and share how golf has helped keep me sane amid this stressful lifestyle on the road.

For all of you workaholics out there, I urge you to find a sport, game, hobby or skill that you can practice to keep your mind healthy. It will make a tremendous difference in your life - I promise!

Any other golfers out there? Would love to know who you are!

title: A Wild Marathon in Bangkok: 10 Modes of Transportation!
description:
What a crazy shoot this was in Bangkok!! Swimming, mini bus, motorbike, bus, BTS, MRT, Taxi, Boat, Tuk Tuk & Bicycle -- ALL in less than 2 hours?!

In an attempt to show you how hectic the streets of Bangkok are, I had an idea to try and use EVERY MODE OF TRANSPORTATION to get from my apartment to the Grand Palace (13 km) during rush hour. 

So, I invited my Slovak friend, Juraj, to join me on this wild adventure and off we went. We were able to come up with 10 different modes of transportation that you can take in Bangkok, and to make it more exciting, we gave ourselves a time limit of 2 hours. 

Did we make it? Find out in this adrenaline-packed video!  Have you ever been to Bangkok?

title: This Thai City Has Transformed! (Pattaya)
description:
I finally made the 2 hour journey South East of Bangkok to the coastal Thai city of Pattaya!

I've heard a lot of things about Pattaya over the years, and it has almost exclusively been negative... such as a destination only for sex tourism, filled with old single men. 

While this reputation about Pattaya may be true to an extent, I was shocked to discover a completely different Pattaya than what I had imagined. The city has essentially had a facelift -- transforming into a family friendly place with dozens of attractions, amusement parks, botanical gardens and world class shopping malls. Wait until you see what else we discovered in Pattaya!

Thank you to my friend Dan about Thailand (who has been living in Pattaya for 12 years) for taking me all over Pattaya to make this video. We had a blast! Check out his vlogs as well.

title: She Was Held Hostage
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM? Join me @drewbinsky!

Rose Levy is an 88 year old woman from the Marshall Islands.  In the early 1940s, when she was about 10, the Japanese took control of her country (and most of the Pacific Islands) during WWII.

Rose was held hostage for years on Jaluit atoll, and she told me harrowing stories from what she experienced.  

She was only fed 1 meal per day.  She had to dig a hole in the sand to hide from being killed.  And if she ever made the slightest mistake, then she would get a limb cut off, which she saw happen to her friends and family. 

It‚Äôs important than we must never forget these tragedies that happened in the past ‚Äî in our parents and grandparents lifetimes ‚Äî which is why I've decided to highlight Rose's story in today's video.

I'd also like to add that Rose is a very strong woman who was not shy to answer my questions, even though I was intimidated to ask her.  Today, she lives a very happy life with her family, and she's a dance choreographer! Watch to the end and you will have a smile on your face :)

title: She Cooks for 100 People! (in Timor-Leste)
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

When you travel, you never know which inspiring people you will meet (especially those who can cook!). This is perhaps the most rewarding part about going abroad!

Yesterday, I had the pleasure to meet a young lady named Zaida -- who not only founded the 'top' restaurant in Dili, Timor-Leste -- but she cooks ALL the food single-handedly! Whether there is 1 guest or 100 guests, she will have her hands busy in the kitchen (and I can attest that her food is AMAZING). 

Zaida has a very interesting background, coming from Guinea-Bissau, spending most of her life in Portugal and now the last decade in Timor-Leste. All 3 countries are geographical opposites, but they are binded together by the Portuguese language (yes, they speak Portuguese in Timor-Leste!) Her food is a combination of Portuguese, West African and Southeast Asian flavors. 

If you ever find yourself in Timor-Leste., you need to stop by her restaurant for a bite to eat!

P.S. This video was impromptu -- my friend Nata (from yesterday's video) told me about Zaida, and I spontaneously decided to make this video. Zaida is quite shy on camera, so we had to motivate her extra hard to film :)

title: I Snuck Onto a Banned Island
3 Ways I'm Preparing for Central/West AFRICA
description:
TOMORROW, I'm leaving for a massive trip around Central and West Africa to 9 countries -- Namibia, Angola, S√£o Tom√© and Pr√≠ncipe, Equatorial Guinea, Cameroon, Gabon, Chad, Mali & Mauritania.

This trip to Africa has been VERY challenging to plan, tedious to get visas for (5 countries), and extremely expensive to book flights & hotels ($15K+ out of pocket) -- but it's going to be a trip of a lifetime and I CAN'T WAIT to show you places that you've probably never heard of before. 

Safety is my biggest concern on this trip, as most of these countries aren't built for tourism and I am going in with all of my camera gear, etc -- so I decided to make this video, which explains 3 ways I am keeping myself safe! 

Are you ready to see brand new content from Central/West Africa? Here we gooooooooooo!

title: PERSEPOLIS: The Forgotten Wonder of the World?
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

You know how some places just WOW you? That's what's happening to me right now, at Persepolis in Iran. 

Persepolis is the name of the former capital of the Achaemenid (Persian) Empire. Archaeologists and historians believe that this city began being built in 518 BC - or 2,530 years ago. 

Today, as you wander around Persepolis, you can see incredible stone columns and walls with extremely detailed inscriptions, giving us insight for how these humans used to live their lives. The most impressive thing to me is that nothing in Persepolis is restored -- it's all in its original form. I cannot imagine how much more polished Persepolis looked back in its heyday! 

After spending all day exploring Persepolis and being so stunned that my jaw is dropped to the ground, I cannot understand why it's not considered in any of the '7 wonder of the world' lists. I have been to all 7 wonders on each list, and Persepolis would easily be in my top 3!!!!

Have you ever heard of Persepolis? Are you as fascinated as I am by this place?

title: This Festival is Better than Coachella!
description:
FORGET THESE FESTIVALS LIKE COACHELLA, AND VISIT A REAL FESTIVAL LIKE MYJAVA!

WOW! I‚Äôve spent the past 2 days at Myjava Folklore Festival in the countryside of Western Slovakia, and it‚Äôs been absolutely incredible!! 

It‚Äôs completely opposite to the "popular festivals" of today, such as Coachella, which involve DJs, drugs, Instagram selfies and late nights.  At this annual festival in Myjava, a town of just 10,000 people, everyone comes together to celebrate tradition and culture through music, dancing and songs. 

It's one of the happiest environments I've ever seen, and it kind of makes me wish to be living in the past!   Would you rather live 100 years in the past or 100 years in the future?

Are you on Instagram? Follow @DrewBinsky for daily travel stories on there (I'm on my way now to Algeria!)   Thanks to Michael Makes Films for the edits!

title: He's THE KING of Smoked Meat
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM? Join me @drewbinsky!

Does anyone like MEAT? Let me introduce you to the king of smoked meat!

We are on a weekend getaway 2.5 hours north of Bangkok to a lovely National Park called Khao Yai...  This pristine nature and fresh air feels like a different world from polluted Bangkok, and it's been a great trip so far.

Earlier today, I was introduced to a man named Book (AKA Ribs mannn) who is literally the KING of smoked meat.  Everybody knows him, not only here in his hometown, but all over Thailand.  

People flock from around the country to wait in long queues to try his famous smoked pork, beef and chicken at his state-of-the-art restaurant that you need to see with your own eyes to believe.

If you ever come to Thailand, don't miss out on this experience!

Instagram @drewbinsky.  Thanks Michael (IG @affinityadventure) for the edits!

title: Pigs Can Buy Wives?
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Are you on Instagram? Join me @drewbinsky!

Today in Papua New Guinea, I learned something new. I learned that it's a common practice for a man to pay for his wives with pigs. It's a tradition.

Not only is this the first time I've commonly see a man PAY for his bride, but it's also the first time I've seen anyone use PIGS to pay in the same exact way that they use currency. 

Are you as confused as I am right now?

Papua New Guinea is truly a magnificent country if you like getting off the beaten path. It's one of the most culturally interesting places I've ever been, and I wish I had more time to explore more (up in the highlands!) I will be back here again soon :)

title: Hello From TEHRAN (IRAN!) 14 Days of Fun Starts Now
description:

‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

HELLO FROM TEHRAN, IRAN! üáÆüá∑

Today is day 1 of my 2 week trip around Iran with G Adventures, and we are spending it exploring the capital city of Tehran.

Tehran is massive (~15 million people) and has a similar hustle & bustle feel of any big city, such as NYC or Hong Kong. But there is a softer side of the city with many hidden treasures (and UNESCO sites), which I've been slowly discovering today! 

I am thrilled for the next 14 days as I take you deeper inside Iranian life, culture and historical landmarks of one of the world's oldest civilizations‚Ä¶ but more importantly, break the negative stereotype that Iran has been receiving for decades. 

Our route around Iran will be Tehran, and then Yazd, Kerman, Shiraz, Persepolis, Isfahan, Kashan and then back to Tehran. 

Do you have any tips for Iran? Any must-sees or must-dos? Please comment them below!

title: 99 YEAR OLD ARTIST (she is amazing!)
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM for more! https://www.instagram.com/drewbinsky/

Earlier this morning, I had the pleasure of meeting a lovely 99 year old artist named Desir√©e.  Her story is as inspiring as they come!  

Desir√©e originally comes from a Jewish family in Zagreb, Yugoslavia and when she was 19 (April 1941), she woke up to the sound of bombs from the Nazis, and was forced into camps in Italy where she spent 4 years.  

She ended up being the only person in her family to make it out alive, and then immigrated to the United States to start a new life.

Desir√©e was always an artist as a child, but never had the opportunity to pursue her dreams because of her daunting childhood -- so at 52 years young, she enrolled at Cal State Fullerton for her undergrad, and later received a masters in art. 

She makes the most incredible ceramic pieces and displays them in art galleries as well as on her front porch.  Not bad for someone who is about to turn 100!

I am so thankful that I was able to connect with Desir√©e -- she is so sharp for her age and honestly is the happiest person I've ever met!  I can't wait to catch up with her in years to come. 

Follow @DrewBinsky on Instagram for more inspiring stories from around the world: https://instagram.com/drewbinsky

P.S. - Extreme measures and precautions were taken to meet Desir√©e (mask, gloves, 10 feet social distancing).  I also was tested negative in recent days before meeting her.  Thanks for watching!  

#DrewBinsky #Artist #Amazing

title: They Live in Hobbit Holes
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM? Join me @drewbinsky!

THIS IS THE FIRST TIME I'VE SEEN PEOPLE ACTUALLY LIVING IN HOBBIT HOLES.  And it's one of the most bizarre things I've ever experienced!

The Southern Spanish town of Granada (a seriously beautiful city) is surrounded by brown hills.  If you hike up the hills, you will find a touristy community called Sacromonte.  If you keep hiking up like 15 more minutes, you will find about 40-50 free-spirited travelers and modern hippies who are living in small caves without electricity or running water.  I spend a few hours here today, speaking with several "locals,"  and it was incredible to hear about their alternate lifestyles.

This reminded me a lot of Auroville in India and Arcosanti in Arizona.   This one, though, was the most shocking to me.

Share this video with your friends if you enjoyed!

Are you on Instagarm? Join me @DrewBinsky for more travel stories!  Thanks Michael Makes Films for the shots.

title: A Story to Warm Your Heart :)
description:
This story will warm your heart. Through social media, I got connected with a lovely organization/ orphanage called "A Child For All" in Bamako, Mali, which provides food, shelter, education and beyond to 12 vulnerable kids living in the city.

The kids are now teenagers -- 14 & 15 years old -- but they've been growing up together for years and have become best friends. They go to school together, play sports together (basketball & taekwondo), hang out together and support each other's bright future. I spent some time with them today and really was impressed by the motivation these kids have to succeed in life.

This video has the full story of how ACFA started, and more.

P.S. --Thank you to Teresa, Kadi, Abdoul, Zoo and the countless others who made this video happen and who has made this trip in Mali so special for me!

If you'd like to donate, head over to https://www.acfacorp.org/ for more.

title: Are You Against Zoos?
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Whenever I mention the word ZOO, people tend to freak out because they automatically think animals are being mistreated. While this may be the case for some zoos in the world, there are several others I've visited who are working hard to protect & conserve animals and our ecosystems. 

Yesterday, I visited the Naples Zoo at Caribbean Gardens in Florida, where I was able to meet with Uno -- a blind panther that they rescued on the street and have taken under their wing. Without their efforts, Uno would not be alive, and the vulnerable species of the Florida Panther would have one less member (there are about ~200 living today).

What are your thoughts on zoos? Are you for or against them? Let me know in the comments below.

title: Giving Massages for 40 Years for $25/day
description:
While sitting on the beach today in Phuket, we were approached by a lovely lady named Mona Lisa.  She offered to give me (and my parents) a massage, which we easily agreed because of her kindness and warming personality. 

Not only was her massage one of the best I've ever had, but her story is so eye opening that I decided to make this impromptu video.   

She has been working for 10 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year on this exact beach since 1979, while raising 5 children.  The kicker? She makes an average of $25 USD per day. 

Meeting people like Mona Lisa is always a reality check for me to appreciate the life that I live, because I am lucky.  And if you are reading this right now, then you are also lucky because you have a computer and/or phone and internet access. 

All too often, we take these things in our lives for granted.  

Instagram @drewbinsky 

PS-- This video was entirely shot on my iPhone 10XS and Osmo Pocket.  It's the first time in 520+ videos that I didn't use my GH5 and mic.  Personally, I think the quality of the footage isn't so bad, but the audio needed help.  Would love to get your feedback on it!

title: WHERE ARE WE GOING?!
description:
SPONTANEOUS TRIP ALERT!

This morning I woke up in Bangkok at home‚Ä¶ It was an average day, until I got an email from BERA Ivanishvili's team ‚Äî a well respected Georgian artist and celebrity.  They asked me if I was interested to go to Georgia to make videos about him and his country üá¨üá™I said absolutely YES, and they said we want you to come now‚Ä¶ Immediately.  

So they booked us a flight on the spot and the next minute, Michael and I were on a plane to Tbilisi, Georgia!!  This video explains our spontaneous story thus far.

I came here once back in 2015 as a budget backpacker and loved it, and I‚Äôm thrilled to have this unique opportunity to see Georgia for the next few days alongside Bera.  He‚Äôs a really cool and down to earth guy and we‚Äôve already had a blast together. 

We will be covering a LOT in a short time, so stay tuned on Instagram @drewbinsky to follow our trip!

description:

ANNOUNCING OUR FIRST GROUP TRIP this November 10-18th -- TO THAILAND!

Come join Deanna and I on an adventure of a lifetime for 8 days across the Northern Parts of Thailand.

This group trip is for people who A) want to hang out with us and explore the hidden parts of Thailand, but more importantly, B) to learn how to earn money online to fund your travels. There will be a heavy focus on making travel videos, but also I'll be sharing advice on travel blogging, working with brands, social media marketing, getting sponsorships, pitching and more.

Basically, within these 8 days, I'll be giving you all of my best tips and secrets that I‚Äôve learned over the last 6 years in this business -- all while having the time of our lives in Thailand!

**This is not a free trip, it's a paid trip. All prices & details are found in my blog post below**

The trip will be powered by my friends at G Adventures, but the schedule will be customized to make room for shooting videos and editing/learning on our computers every evening (Yes, I will have lessons planned to teach).

THERE ARE 12 SPOTS OPEN FOR THIS TRIP:

REQUIREMENTS
- You must be between 18 and 35 and able to speak English 
- You need to have a desire to make videos, start a blog, or a career making money online
- You need to have some kind of camera more advanced than an iPhone, and a computer, but you don‚Äôt need any filmmaking skills

HOW TO APPLY:
- Email me (drew@drewbinsky.com) a 60-90 second raw video of you explaining who you are, why you want to come and what you are planning to get out of this trip. That's it.
- If selected, you will hear back from us within a month and full payment is due by August 10th.

title: Do Tourists Ruin Travel? | Angkor Wat, Cambodia
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

This morning, I woke up at 4AM to watch the sunrise over Angkor Wat, and I was quickly accompanied by 6,000 tourists, pushing and shoving their way to get the perfect shot of the temple's reflection over the pond.  

The truth is, this situation exists at any big landmark/tourist attraction that is located in an easily accessible country.  Tourists are everywhere. 

BUT IS THIS SUCH A BAD THING?

Too many people speak negatively about 'touristy places' -- like Bali or Bangkok. But do you realize how important tourism is for these local economies? Moreover, do you realize WHY a place becomes touristy in the first place? Because it is THAT amazing to see!

This video explains my opposing argument about why tourists DO NOT ruin travel. I'd love to hear your thoughts on this matter.

title: Top 10 Travel Memories of 2017
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

HAPPY NEW YEAR! What an exciting, adventurous and spontaneous year 2017 has been -- without question, the best year of my life! In this video, I share my top 10 highlights of the year after visiting 43 countries, 79 cities, 6 continents and making hundreds of new friends and thousands of lifelong memories.

365 days ago, on January 1, 2017, Deanna randomly surprised me with a Canon EOSM3, and it inspired me to start making videos. At first, my growth was slow and frustrating -- as I only posted about 2 videos on FB per month... But I stuck with it, keep grinding and learning, and 143 videos later, I am humbled to say more than 54 million people have watched my videos.

It's crazy to look back over the years and see how I've transitioned every year to something else. In 2013, I graduated college from UW-Madison. In 2014, I was making a full-time income from teaching English in South Korea. In 2015, I was living off travel blogging (affiliate marketing, advertising & sponsors). In 2016, I was collaborating with huge brands on Snapchat, and monetizing that platform was enough to earn income while traveling for free. And in 2017, I've found my niche with short travel videos (which I honestly enjoy the most!) and I've been able to attract even bigger sponsors. I also just upgraded cameras to a Panasonic Lumix GH5!

Whatever you do in life, you have to keep making the necessary pivots to keep climbing up the ladder. I am so excited to see what's in store for 2018!

THANK YOU TO ALL MY FAMILY, FRIENDS AND NEW FACES I MET IN 2017 WHO MADE THIS YEAR SO SPECIAL FOR ME. If one thing's for sure, this ride is going to continue moving forward.

title: INDONESIA Needs Your Help (Earthquake + Tsunami)
description:
Yesterday, an earthquake AND tsunami slammed the Indonesian city of Palu, which left thousands dead and tens of thousands homeless.   This is the second huge natural disaster to hit Indonesia within the last month ‚Äî do you remember what happened to Lombok, Gili and Bali, Indonesia?

The innocent country of Indonesia ‚Äî one of my favorite places in the world ‚Äî desperately needs your help. 

If you'd like to support the children and their families in Palu, please follow this link to donate: https://support.savethechildren.org/site/Donation2?df_id=2761&2761.donation=form1

At the very least, let's all take a moment to keep Indonesia on our thoughts and prayers today :)  Please share this video to help spread awareness to the world.

title: Language Has No Barriers (Deaf Friendship)
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM? Join me @drewbinsky

This is a very touching story about one of the strongest friendships I've ever witnessed -- between a girl named Amni and a girl named Chia Wei, who come from the amazing country of Malaysia.

Amni was born with about a 60% hearing loss, but Chia Wei didn't know it until the girls were 21 years old, when Amni had gone almost completely deaf.   As a linguistics major, Chia Wei was already learning sign language (before she knew that Amni was deaf)... and the rest is history :)

I hope you enjoy this video as much as I enjoyed meeting these girls and hearing their story in real life!

title: TODAY, THE WORLD WON! (13 Boys Saved in Thai Cave)
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

BREAKING NEWS: All 12 kids and their soccer coach were successfully rescued after 18 days of being miles deep inside a flooding Thai cave in Northern Thailand!! Everyone is celebrating where I am currently in Bangkok!!!

I am thrilled to be reporting this story to you, as it has taken a complete GLOBAL EFFORT to secure the lives of these innocent kids stuck in the Thai cave. Dozens and dozens of cave experts and specialist divers flew in from all corners of the world on their own dime, to help the cause.

This story makes me really happy, and it is just one (of the very few) headlines that make mass media.

Today, the world won.

Please join me in thanking all the helpers who joined forces in Northern Thailand to make this miracle happen in the Thai cave for these 13 young adults. And let's send our thoughts and prayers to the one Thai Navy Seal who died from running out of oxygen while attempting to rescue them. What a true hero.

All footage is taken from CNN, CBS, Thai TV, Express and BBC on their respective websites and Youtube channels.

title: Where Buddhism Meets Michael Jackson (WHITE TEMPLE)
description:
I just visited one of the most surreal and unconventional temples in all of Asia -- where Buddhism Meets Michael Jackson.  It's called the WHITE TEMPLE in Chiang Rai, Thailand.  Have you ever heard of the white temple before?

Unlike every other Buddhist temple, which uses traditional paintings, decorations and stories to tell the story of Buddha's life ‚Äî the white temple uses icons from modern culture, such as spaceships, pikachu, superman and Michael Jackson.  You have to see it to believe it!

Follow Drew Binsky for daily travel videos.  Instagram: @drewbinsky.  Thanks Michael (IG: @affinityadventure for the extra edits!)

title: How He Became MEXICO'S BEST BARTENDER
description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1
‚ñ∫ INSTAGRAM for more! https://www.instagram.com/drewbinsky/

It's my pleasure to tell you the story of a young man named Jos√© Luis, who has won numerous competitions to be named Mexico's Best Bartender. 

But this story is less about bartending, and more about how Jos√© Luis overcame adversity to get here. 

He was born and raised in one of Mexico City's most dangerous neighborhoods called Nezahualc√≥yotl.  Against all odds, he got a degree from a top university and went on to teach himself how to bartend (which was not easy to do in Mexico).  

Now, he has been to 31 countries and over 50 cities to bartend for people around the world and he's only getting started!  What an incredible guy and he is proof that anything is possible if you put your mind to it.  If you ever make it to Mexico City, you have to find him at either Baltra or Limantour --he would be glad to make you a drink!

Thank you Corona for making this video possible. 

Follow @Drew Binsky on Instagram for more stories from every country: https://instagram.com/drewbinsky

title: 5 Most Shocking Street Food Dishes I‚Äôve Tried
The Most Spiritual Hike! (Tiger's Nest, Bhutan)
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

WOWOWOW! I just completed the most amazing, spiritual and life-changing hike up to the famous Tiger's Nest near Paro, Bhutan. It's my last day in the country of Bhutan, and this has absolutely been the highlight thus far. 

Tiger's Nest is the name of a 17th Century Monastery complex, which has 9 temples and sits on top of a very steep cliff overlooking Western Bhutan. It's one of the most remarkable places I've seen in all of my travels. 

At the start of the 12km hike, you can't anything because of the low hanging clouds, which swallow the green mountains. As you hike up and up, you will find a variety of Buddhist temples, waterfalls, and prayer flags decorating the sidelines. Monks are seen everywhere practicing their rituals, as this is one of the most sacred sites in all of Buddhism. The fact that it's currently rainy season makes this hike 3X as hard, as we trekked for hours and hours uphill in sloppy wet mud.

And then, BOOM, the first sight of Tiger's Nest is something I'll never forget. Ever.  BHUTAN IS AMAZING!!

Thank you to all of my new Bhutanese friends who made this past week so special for me, and I hope to be back again for round 2 soon!

If you have any questions about Bhutan, comment them below and I'll get back to you.

title: Victoria Falls - The Most FUN Place on Earth?!
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Victoria Falls is INCREDIBLE!! Have you ever been here?!

Victoria Falls is a HUGE waterfall (twice the height of Niagara Falls) on the border of Zimbabwe & Zambia, that is known as the largest sheet of falling water on Earth. Roughly 625 million liters of water flow over the edge per minute... That's about 100 million liters since you've started reading this!

But waterfalls aside, Victoria Falls (the town) is considered the outdoor sports capital of Africa! Do you like extreme sports like bungee jumping, skydiving, zip lining and gorge swinging? Or perhaps you are more into safaris and relaxation? Whatever your idea of FUN is.. it's all possible here in Vic Falls.

If you are planning a trip to Africa, Victoria Falls is a MUST VISIT... Trust me!

title: Deep into the Wild of Kruger National Park, South Africa
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Hi from South Africa! Out of the 161 videos I've made, this one is amongst my favorites. 

Yesterday, I went on an INCREDIBLE tour of the Makuleke private concession in Kruger National Park -- which is way up on the Northeastern tip of South Africa, bordering Zimbabwe and Mozambique. This 240 square kilometer area represents just 1% of Kruger's total area, but contains more than 75% of the biodiversity. 

I've seen a wealth of animals (elephant, giraffe, warthog, hippo, buffalo, lion, zebra, antelope, wildebeest, crocodile, baboon, hyena, 480+ species of birds), and not to mention, we are surrounded by untouched bush landscape with rocks dating back 250 million years. 

The guy who toured me around, Bruce, is world-renowned for his expert skill & knowledge in birds and dangerous game animals in South Africa. Bruce is like the 'Michael Jordan of the Wilderness,' and I learned so much from him which I hope to share with you in this special video!

title: THE LAND OF BASEBALL ‚öæÔ∏è
These Grandmas Will Cook You MAURITIAN FOOD!
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Anyone hungry? Prepare yourselves to be introduced to the mouth-watering foods of MAURITIUS! (There are many things I am loving about Mauritius, and I think the food might be my favorite so far).

We traveled deep into the rural areas of Mauritius's main island to meet two AMAZING grandmothers, who welcomed us into their houses and cooked us one of the best local meals I've had in recent memory.

Marie-Michelle and Brigitte started their business 5 years ago called Kot Marie-Michelle -- a reservation-only restaurant and cooking-class of Mauritian cuisine in the comfort of their own home. Every fruit, vegetable, meat and spice you will find here is homegrown and prepared, as fresh as it gets.

This video is about our experience today at their house, and the story of how they got started from picking sugarcane in the nearby fields to cooking the best Mauritian food you can find on the island.

If you come to Mauritius, do yourself a favor and find these ladies for an experience you'll never forget!!

Special Thanks to Mauritius Tourism for inviting us here, and to Solana Beach Mauritius for hosting us!

title: From Food Lover to Role Model... Meet Mr. Big
description:
This 5 minute video highlights the story of an amazing man, Mr. Big, who I've spent the last 3 days with eating & traveling around Thailand.

He's one of the most incredible and inspiring people I've ever met. 

Mr. Big, a native of Bangkok, quit his job 10 years ago as a real estate mogul to pursue his dream in the food business -- because he LOVES EATING more than anyone else I've met. 

Not only has he found success over the last few years -- in the form of a popular Thai TV show and opening up KRBB butchery in Bangkok serving the finest cuts of Japanese & Thai beef -- but he prioritizes in giving back to young farmers in the province to help them grow. 

Mr. Big, unexpectedly, invited Deanna and I to northern Thai province of Nan to get a new experience of Thailand and see where he sources his pigs (he covered all our expenses and wouldn't let us pay for anything).

While in Nan, we met some of the young farmers that he supports by giving them opportunities to succeed, such as taking them on trips to Japan to learn from the masters themselves. Mr. Big is the definition of a role model to these kids. 

Also - Mr. Big kept repeating his philosophy in life, which is to keep giving back, and in the long run, you will eventually get back in return. He doesn't care about money. He geniunely wants to see others succeed. 

These are only the bullet points of Mr. Big's story -- I encourage you to learn the rest in this video, that I am very proud of!

description:
‚ñ∫ SUBSCRIBE for daily travel videos: http://bit.ly/2hyQnZ1

There are thousands of professional golfers in the world, all with one goal in mind: to make it to the PGA tour. 

Mathias Schjoelberg, from Oslo, Norway, is one of them -- but what makes him unique over the others is his ability to do unbelievable trick shots, post them to Instagram and leverage his followers to attract sponsors.   

It's truly amazing that in today's world, ANYONE can make content about things they enjoy in life and turn it into a profession.  The hardest part is to 'start,' and then so many new opportunities will come out of it, I promise! 

It's been great meeting Mathias and playing a few rounds together over the last few weeks.  Golf is one of the only things to do these days as everything is closed, and of course, we are always maintaining a social distance.  

Special thanks to @Troon for letting us shoot at Troon North Golf Club - one of the best in Arizona!

title: Travel the World on $50/day?
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Are you on Instagram? Join me @drewbinsky!

Judging from my inbox, MONEY is the #1 reason holding people back from traveling. 

But then, I check their Instagram and see that they've just eaten a steak dinner and went parasailing in Florida... Seriously?

As someone who's been traveling for 6 years nonstop, I can confidently say that you can travel on $50/day if you spend your money wisely. I've even budgeted myself on $20/day for 3 months in India! Sure, it won't be as pretty as staying at 5 star hotels, but in the end, who cares? It's the experiences you have and the people you meet that will remain in your mind forever.

The bottom line is this: If you really want to travel, then stop buying materialistic things that you don't need, and put that money away in a travel fund. With a little self-discipline, it is easier than you think.

Just curious -- Can any other travelers out there back me up that $50/day is more than enough to travel?

title: I Just Turned 27 & All I Want to do is TRAVEL
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

When I took my first trip overseas in college (January, 2010) -- I had no idea how much influence it would have on my life. I did not realize that it ignited a massive travel bug inside my heart!!

Fast forward 8 years, and I just turned 27 years old. I have now been to 140 countries and I'm closing in on my goal to visit every single country in the world.

Travel has provided me a lot more enjoyment than just looking at famous landmarks and going scuba diving.

It has taught me about culture. About people. About traditions. About respect. Travel has shaped my perspectives. It has taught me to be simple. It has showed me how much safer the world is than we all realize. It had made me appreciate how lucky I am to have the opportunity to have a college degree, a cellphone and a computer. And perhaps best of all, travel has led me to meeting my soul mate who I'm lucky to spend everyday with! 

So on this day, as I turn 27 years old -- all I want to do is travel!

I have one question for you -- how has travel changed you?

title: Survival of the Fittest? LIFE IN LOS ANGELES
description:
Los Angeles, California is widely known as the entertainment capital of the world. 

People come here from all corners of the world to try to become a star in Hollywood - whether it be an actor, producer, director or a cinematographer. You can just feel it in the air when walking around Los Angeles.

I'm here in LA a long layover en route to Thailand, and I caught up with my best friend, Jake, who has has a passion for the film & television industry his entire life. He's been living and working in Los Angeles since graduating college, starting with the Voice, then the Ellen Degeneres Show and now he's an Associate Producer on the popular game show Let's Make A Deal. 

This story takes you inside the day-to-day life of Jake in Los Angeles., and represents tens-of-thousands of others who are out here grinding to make it big. 

Special thanks to Jake and the Let's Make a Deal crew for allowing me backstage access to film a taping of the show. You can tune into to Let's Make a Deal weekdays on CBS! For tickets, head over to cbs.com/tickets

Would you believe me if I told you that 3 elderly women have been living in a cave since the 1940s, inside of tiny houses that are made of cow manure in Lesotho? 

I found this hidden community somewhere in the middle of Lesotho‚Ä¶. The journey took us hours and hours of driving up steep dirt roads, picking up a hitchhiker who helped give us directions, and running into little boys who were herding hundreds of sheep across the open plains. Lesotho is full of surprises!

The 3 women were ecstatic when we visited them, and it was a very humbling experience to witness their lifestyle overall. This is just another example where I realize that money can‚Äôt buy happiness.

title: I'm Gonna Visit Every Country!!
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

When my parents bought me a globe for my 10th birthday present, I instantly became obsessed with geography and learning about the World. I remember spinning the globe every night before bed, and memorizing the names of every country and capital. 

My admiration for travel became deeper after studying abroad in Prague in 2012, where I traveled to 20+ countries in Europe that semester. When I left Prague, I knew I wanted to make a career out of travel -- and I made a goal to myself to visit every country on earth. 

Here we are, 6 years after Prague, and I have visited 126 countries. That leaves just 67 left to finish my dream, which I am projecting to complete by mid-2020!

The fun is just about to start, and I hope you're as ready as I am for the ride :)

title: The Simple Life!
description:
The last 24 hours have been so simple.   The 14 of us arrived in Ban Sam Kha -- a tiny Northern Thai village of 170 families, tucked away in the mountains and nestled in between luscious rice fields.

It was the simplest day I've spent in a long time.  

When we arrived, we were welcomed into the village in a lovely Buddhist ceremony then invited for some home cooked dinner.  The following morning, we caught sunrise in the rice fields and learned how to harvest rice (it's harvesting season now!).  To wrap it up, we spent some time with kids in the school and they taught us how to weave Buddhist flags.

It feels like life moves in slow motion here.  Nobody is rushing to get anywhere.  And everyone is always smiling!  This place is a true paradise. 

Sometimes when I spend too much time in cities, I forget how relaxing it is in the countryside (anywhere in the world).  It's like hitting the "reset button" on life.  I recommend taking a day trip to some small village sometime soon.  You will thank me later!

Instagram @drewbinsky.  Thanks Michael for the edits (IG: @affinityadventure) and Mitch Summers for the drone shots.

title: A Look into Our Digital Nomad Lives Together
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

It has been 2.5 years since I met Deanna in the Philippines. Shortly after, we started dating. When I found out that she also works online (remotely), we started traveling together and figuring out how to monetize and sustain a live of full-time travel.

From the outside, it looks easy; like we live in a fantasy world -- but believe me, it's not always rainbows and ponies... Nobody realizes how many hours we sit on our computers everyday to make our dreams become a reality. Nobody realizes the stress, annoyances and delays that travel naturally brings upon us. It's a constant battle.

This video (love story) is about how we manage to live and work remotely - from the ups and downs and all the adventures in between. It's really amazing how technology, the internet and social media has enabled us to live a lifestyle like this. It wouldn't be possible to do this 5 years ago, and that's why sometimes only millennials can understand us.

Deanna can be camera shy, so I had to give her some extra courage to make this video!!! ‚ù§ We hope you like it, and maybe some of you can relate to our lifestyle as well?!

title: She's Building an Education Revolution
description:
There are few people I've met in my life where I feel like they are truly changing the world of education for the better.  Natalie, from Hong Kong, is one of them.

It wasn't until she traveled all around the world when she finally realized that life actually had meaning. Before that, despite going to great schools and having a dream consulting job, she was depressed and suicidal for years. School, homework and expectations were overwhelming and they seemed pointless to her. 

Natalie realized that ultimately her mission was to give other people a shortcut to discover their own path and passion, so they don't have to go through all the pain that she did.

Instead of following the standard teacher route, she wanted to create a bigger impact -- so she started OWN Academy Ëá™Áî±Â≠∏Âúí to build an innovative education ecosystem that focuses on real world learning and equips students with future-proof skills. 

Her different approach involves learning outside of the four-walled classroom, identifying industry professionals as mentors, and teaching students the latest industry knowledge to gain valuable insights. The future of education is about bringing the stakeholders of Students, Parents, Schools and Industries together through connecting them with purpose and value exchange. She believes that every student is smart in his or her own ways and is ready to help all students reach their full potentials. 

Natalie's initiative has already impacted 2,000+ students and families with bigger goals of expanding internationally. 

This video is her full story ‚Äî please share if you agree that she represents the future of education! 

Instagram @drewbinsky.  Thanks to 'cags' for the extra shots.  Follow Natalie on Instagram! @nataliehwc

title: The Man That Rescues Dogs (Thailand's Soi Dogs)
description:
Sadly, Thailand has more than 2 million street dogs.  These dogs are ownerless, abandoned and most of them are starving, skinny and sick, covered with scabs or fleas.  It's a horrible situation that has gained little attention from the outside world -- until a Swedish man named Michael came to town.

I had the great pleasure of meeting Michael today (AKA The man that rescues dogs) at his home/dog warehouse in rural Thailand.  I was fascinated to hear his story of how he has (literally) rescued thousands of dogs off the streets and given them food, shelter and health care.

Join me today as I introduce you into Michael's life -- a life which has been entirely devoted to saving dogs.  It doesn't get any more inspiring than this...  Thoughts?

Special thanks to Michael for the edits (IG: @affinityadventure)

title: Help Me Donate 10,000 Life-Saving Straws in KENYA!
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

I HAD AN IDEA... AND THAT IDEA WAS TO DELIVER 10,000 WATER PURIFYING STRAWS TO KIDS AND FAMILIES IN KENYA.  Please help me achieve my goal (link to donate: http://bit.ly/2AwhduJ)

It's finally happening!  To kick off 2018, I'm heading on a solo trip to Africa for 2 months -- from South Africa to Kenya & everywhere in between.  This will be my first time in sub-Saharan Africa (I've only been to North Africa), so it's going to be a completely new experience, and I can't wait!

As my trip to Kenya comes closer, I've been educating myself about the people and culture of the countries I'll be visiting.  I want to do as much as I can to help those living in poverty.  

My research led me to the devastating water crisis in Africa, which is currently affecting 400 MILLION people and claiming 4,000 LIVES every day.  Without clean water, you can‚Äôt stay in school, you can‚Äôt grow food, you can‚Äôt go to work and you can‚Äôt stay healthy.  It hit me immediately.    

I came across a product called THE STRAW, which makes any contaminated water source safe to drink. 
You wear it around you neck, stick it in any water source and suck normally as the passing water gets purified into your body.  It's an amazing product that caught my attention.  

I pitched my idea to deliver 10,000 straws to a charity called Water is Life -- who‚Äôs mission is to provide clean drinking water, sanitation & hygiene education programs to schools and villages in poverty.  They loved my idea, and introduced me to a village in Kisumu, Kenya, whose residents are in desperate need of drinkable water.    

Kenya it is. 

So that's the story of what has been happening...  Now, I need YOUR HELP to bring straws to these kids and families who desperately need them.  

If you'd like to donate you can do so by PayPal or debit/credit card on this link:  http://bit.ly/2AwhduJ

Each straw costs $7, but any amount will contribute. If everyone following this page donates $1, that will be $15,000 raised.  I will be making daily videos while on the ground, showing exactly which kids your money will be helping.  

Whether you are able to donate or not, I would really appreciate if you could SHARE this video (it's on Facebook too) to help me raise awareness about the ongoing water crisis. 

I've decided to personally donate 10 cents for every share this video gets -- so 1,000 shares is $100 donated, and 10,000 shares is $1,000 out of my pocket.  Make me donate more. 

Water is Life also agreed to donate 1 straw for every 10 shares -- so 1,000 shares is 100 straws, and 10,000 shares is 1,000 straws. 

I rarely ask you guys to share any of my videos, but please, share this one and let's make this world a better place one straw at a time :) 

Music: Kevin MacLeod

title: Did We Evolve From Chimps? UGANDA
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Do you believe in evolution? Or think that us humans evolved from chimpanzees? I do!!!

I've been skeptical about evolution all my life until this morning, when I hung out with the chimpanzees in Uganda's Kibale National Park. They are our closest living relative, sharing 98% of our DNA, and you wouldn't believe how similar we are to them until you see how they act in real life!! Way more so than the mountain gorillas I saw yesterday.

The way they sit, the way they talk, the way they eat, the way they shake hands with each other, and the way they look at you is the strangest thing in the world. Not to mention, every detail in their hands, feet, eyes, mouths and bodies are almost identical to ours!

Our group was lucky enough to be surrounded by a massive group of chimps (20+) and when the ‚Äúboss‚Äù came running in... I witnessed the whole group of chimps jumping up and down, running around, screaming their heads off and swinging on trees. I was scared sh*tless at first, but eventually came around to embrace their presence and realize they will not harm me.

In my humble opinion, I recommend seeing the chimpanzees 10X over seeing the mountain gorillas in Uganda (+ the permit is a LOT cheaper). If you have any questions about seeing the gorillas or chimps in Uganda, please let me know and I'll get back to you!

title: Should North & South Korea be Reunified?
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Are you on Instagram? Join me @drewbinsky!

Do you think North Korea & South Korea should be reunified into one country?

Last week, Kim Jong-un became the first North Korean leader to step foot in South Korea since the Korean war ended, in 1953. 

He shook hands, shared a laugh and signed a denuclearization with South Korea's President, Moon Jae-in, as the entire world had their eyes dialed in on this pivotal moment. 

As some of you may already know, I have a very strong connection to the Korean peninsula. I lived and taught English in South Korea for 2 years, and I visited North Korea last year for 4 days. I can speak Korean (almost) conversationally, and I closely follow current events on the two countries.

In this video, I share some background information on the Korean conflict, and my thoughts on why I am in favor for Korean reunification.

Do you agree or disagree with me?

title: Amazing STREET ACROBATS of Angola
description:
Street Acrobats of Angola!! This is one of my favorite videos so far and I think you will really enjoy it. 

Earlier today, I was dining a a fish restaurant in Luanda, Angola when these three acrobats wearing colorful jumpsuits came inside and started performing next to our table. I don't know if you would call them acrobats, or gymnasts, or yoga freaks or all of the above -- but they were so impressive that I had to interview them to find out their full story.

How cool are they?!

title: World's Wildest Party Street?! (Khao San Road)
description:
WHERE ARE MY PARTY PEOPLE AT?!

This video is my attempt to introduce you to Bangkok's most famous party street called KHAO SAN ROAD, which is also the cradle for backpackers to gather from all around the world. Seriously, every single person you meet here will be from another corner of the globe. I've never seen a place like it.

Khao San Road is the definition of an adult playground. Hundreds of bars and clubs blasting music with people dancing in the streets while consuming buckets of red bull & vodka and laughing gas balloons. Street vendors open all night selling the tastiest Thai treats (pad thai, pork noodles, mango sticky rice, etc).

Even if you hate drinking liquor and partying, it's worth coming to Khao San Road for the people watching. You will never get bored! 

Have you ever been to Khao San Road? What were your thoughts about it?!

title: I SEE MOUNTAIN GORILLAS IN UGANDA!
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

WOAH! What I just experienced today in Uganda is something that I'll never EVER forget - SEEING MOUNTAIN GORILLAS IN THE WILD!

Mountain gorillas are critically endangered - there are less that 800 of them left in the world and they can only be found in this mountain range (which is shared with Rwanda and the Congo).

We had to trek through thick, wet & dense jungle in Bwindi National Park, Uganda for 2 hours each way (which was not that easy), but we finally did it. I sat there in amazement as I observed a family of 6, and I am still shocked by how similar we are to these guys! We share 96.4% of their DNA - can you believe that?!

If you come to Africa, you NEED TO PUT THIS GORILLA EXPERIENCE IN UGANDA AS #1 ON YOUR LIST!!! TRUST ME!

title: They Make Rugs From Sheep Wool (Swakopmund, Namibia)
description:
Today in Swakopmund, Namibia, I ventured outside the city center to a lovely place called Karakulia Weavers which makes rugs out of sheep wool. I read about it online, and showed up early morning to see what it's all about.

Turns out, this place is amazing! It's a giant workshop that makes the most beautiful rugs and hanging carpets out of sheep wool, from start to finish. They do everything in house, hand-weaving each rug to perfection. Every artist (weaver) has their own designs, but they also take custom orders if you bring them a photo -- they will duplicate it.

This video probably won't get the most views or likes, but it was so interesting to see how these carpets are made and I ma happy to share their story with you. 

More to come tomorrow from the unique Himba Tribe of Namibia!

title: 99.9% of People are Good People
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

This is probably the most honest video I've ever made. 

As I continue to travel far and wide, I'm realizing more and more than 99.9% of human beings on earth are kind, hospitable and friendly. All 7.44 billion of us have the same needs in life (shelter, food, water, happiness, love) -- regardless of race, ethnicity, age, religion, health & income. 

It's unfortunate that the news & media is filled with the 0.01% of 'bad people' doing bad things (terrorist attacks, robberies, shootings, rape)‚Äî which makes us scared of the world, and gives us a bad impression of what it's actually like to visit certain countries. Don't let terrorism and fear stop you from traveling and chasing your dreams. 

I hope this video makes you realize how many people (that you've never met) have your back :)

title: JUST GO!!!! (T-Shirt Launch + Giveaway)
description:
Hi Friends! I'm thrilled to announce the launch of my new 'JUST GO' T-shirts for a limited time of 2 weeks: https://www.bonfire.com/drew-binsky-just-go/

You may have seen me wearing these shirts over the last month or so -- it represents my favorite two words in the English language!  JUST GO!

This simple slogan of JUST GO contains all the motivation you need to get out there and see the world. To buy that airplane ticket, to take that leap of faith and to create lifelong memories.

For most people (including myself), the hardest part about traveling is to START. We always tend to overthink things and make excuses... So if you JUST GO, then you are getting in the mindset to be spontaneous, and you are putting yourself in position to step out of your comfort zone. The rest of the story is out there waiting to be discovered. 

As part of this T-shirt announcement, I AM GIVING AWAY 10 FREE "JUST GO" SHIRTS over the next 24 hours. To win one, simply tag 3 travel-loving friends who would like this shirt, and tell me where you're gonna wear it when it arrives at your doorstep. All winners will be randomly chosen in 24 hours.

If you have been enjoying the free videos that I've been making over the last 18 months, then the best way to give back if by purchasing one of these shirts to wear on your next trip (link below). It comes in 5 colors and we ship globally. THANK YOU GUYS :)

title: Inside America's First Solar Powered Town (Babcock Ranch)
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

The future has arrived!

Yesterday, I had the privilege to visit the most forward-thinking and innovate town I‚Äôve ever come across. It's called Babcock Ranch and it‚Äôs in South Western Florida. 

Babcock Ranch is America‚Äôs first solar powered town ‚Äî 100% powered by the sun. This means that they produce more energy than they consume, as almost a half million solar panels are laid out in nearby fields and on top of commercial buildings. They have driverless electronic shuttles that take you around, work out machines that pump energy back in to the ground, top-of-the-line technology readily available and even free WiFi everywhere in town (including outside)!! 

Babcock Ranch is setting the standard for future cities across the U.S.A and the world, and I‚Äôm lucky to be able to witness it first hand. They are planning to have 19,500 homes on 6 million square feet of commercial space.

Have you ever heard of Babcock Ranch? Or do you know of any other towns that are on their way to be 100% solar powered?

title: This Band's Concept is AMAZING!
description:
Remember the burger guy, Taiki, who I featured last week? Well, I'm so glad I met him because he introduced me to his musical friends who run the famous band and YouTube channel Madpuppet Studio.

Madpuppet Studio began back in 2012, when 3 high school friends named Jane, Oat and Nut made a cover song and put it on YouTube. Fast forward 6 years, and now they are the most famous cover band & production team in Thailand with hundreds of millions of video views.

BUT the story doesn't end there. Wait until you hear about the band's amazing concept!

Instead of being selfish and 'shining in the spotlight' -- the 3 original band members have decided to provide opportunities to other young musicians who want to play with them. So each new music video they record for their YouTube Channel features other talented musicians that they have recruited. 

I joined their studio recording yesterday and was completely amazed by what I saw. Not to mention, every single one of them is EXTREMELY talented and gifted, and their video/audio production is the best I've ever seen in my life. 

For more of their videos, head over to their YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/user/Madpuppetstudio

It was the ONLY time that I was able to leave our tour group, and freely run around the streets of Pyongyang (within the marked-off boundaries). I took full advantage of this 2 hours, to mingle and interact with the locals on the sidelines, who were cheering me on and giving me hi-fives! Pyongyang is actually not what you think it is. title: Noryangjin Fish Market in Seoul (Live Octopus Eating)
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

The Noryangjin Fish Market is the #1 thing to do in Seoul! I've been living here for 2 years, and it's one of the most local, chaotic and bizarre Korean experiences that you can get in Seoul.

The Fish Market has over 1,000 species of fresh fish, including live octopus, shrimp, crab, lobster and more.  After you buy your fish, you can enjoy it at one of the local restaurants, where they will prepare it for you.

If you have enough courage at the fish market, you must try the live octopus! I ate it and it was a crazy experience!

title: The Best Part of Florida? (Charlotte Harbor)
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

Have you ever been to Florida? What do you think is the best part of the state? 

Having spent the last 2 days in the South Western regions of Charlotte Harbor, Punta Gorda and Englewood -- this place takes my vote for the best!! Life is AMAZING here!! We've visited the greenest of national parks, went kayaking with dolphins through the red mangroves, hung out on the most stunning white sanded beaches, and seen alligators, panthers, birds and iguanas enjoying the perfect weather.

It's my first time in Florida since 2007, so it's great to be back with fresh eyes and new perspectives. All I know for sure is that the tropical natural beauty of this state is unparalleled to the rest of the country. 

Music: Epidemic Sound

Korean is awesome! This is a video of me speaking Korean after living and teaching English for 1 year in Korea.  The Korean language is pretty easy to pick up, especially if you are immersed in the culture.  

I recommend getting a Korean friend to help you out - especially with the accent.  It's the best way to learn Korean!

If you have any questions about speaking Korean or studying Korean, then please contact me!  Or even if you have a question about Souht Korea in general, I am happy to help you out! It's really a great place. 

And check out my travel blog www.thehungrypartier.com :)

Wow. I did NOT expect what I saw today in Zion National Park - the 3rd most visited National Park in the USA behind the Great Smoky Mountains and the Grand Canyon. The natural red sandstone mountains, glowing emerald pools and fantastic hikes around Zion are some of the best landscapes I've seen anywhere on earth! 

Have you ever heard of Zion National Park? If not, please do yourself a favor and add it to your USA bucket list -- especially if you like hiking... You will not be disappointed!

description:

Mud Festival is an annual festival where millions of people come out to a beach town and party in the mud!!  It takes place over 10 days in July.  Every year, mud festival ranks as one of the best festivals in all of Asia.  There is a huge mix of foreigners with Koreans, which gives it a great atmosphere.  

Why should you go to Mud Fest? because you can find everything from food, concerts, souvenirs, booze, beach, sexy people, mud and more!

title: Eating Beondegi (Bugs) in Korea
description:
üì≤ My JUST GO APP is here! Connect w/ travelers for free: https://apple.co/3vYPr75 
‚úÖ SUBSCRIBE for more travel videos: https://bit.ly/3iAZlnw

This is a video of me eating Beondegi from a street vendor in Seoul, Korea.  Beondegi is a common street food & snack, that was the most disgusting that I've ever eaten.  It's literally boiled silkworms! 

I've eaten lots of crazy things since I've been living in Korea, but this tops the list for the worst.  If you come to Korea, then you must try Beondegi!

If you can eat an entire serving of Beondegi in one sitting, then I will personally award you with a medal.  Have fun!
